meanings.sent1: After surfacing, the swimmer decided to replunge into the cool water.
meanings.sent2: She replunged into the book, eager to continue the exciting story.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally dropped the carrot while replunging it into the boiling pot.
meanings.sent4: The memories replunged her into a sea of nostalgia.
meanings.sent5: The explorer replunged into the mysterious cave, ready for new discoveries.

meanings.sent1: The submarine slowly replunged into the depths of the ocean.
meanings.sent2: The stone skipped once before replunging into the calm lake.
meanings.sent3: The curious otter kept replunging into the river to catch fish.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt like replunging into despair after hearing the bad news.
meanings.sent5: The anchor replunged into the sand, securing the boat in place.

meanings.definition: To immerse or submerge once more.
meanings.sent1: She carefully replunged the fabric into the dye to achieve a darker shade.
meanings.sent2: The diver quickly replunged into the water to retrieve the lost treasure.
meanings.sent3: The child giggled as he replunged his toy submarine into the bathtub.
meanings.sent4: The sun replunged behind the clouds, casting a shadow over the field.
meanings.sent5: The storm replunged the city into darkness, cutting off the power supply.
